data.title: Restaurants to Spot Celebrities in Los Angeles. Restaurants That Celebrities Love.
data.meta_description: Where to Eat for Celebrity Encounters in LA. Discover the best restaurants for star spotting in the Los Angeles area. Explore our guide to dining hotspots frequented by celebrities, where you might just share a table with your favorite stars.
data.text:
Star-Studded Eateries:

Where Celebrities Dine in Los Angeles

Untitled Document

Updated on Jul 01 2024 7:51am

Step into the culinary world of Los Angeles, where dining isn't just about the food, but also the chance to rub elbows with the stars themselves.

Los Angeles isn't just a city for great food; it's also a hotspot for celebrity sightings. Whether you're a food enthusiast or a star-struck fan, dining in LA can offer more than just a delicious meal—it could be your ticket to spotting your favorite celebrity in their natural habitat. From trendy eateries to iconic culinary landmarks, here's where you need to dine if you want to up your chances of a celebrity encounter in the City of Angels.

Untitled Document

FEATURED TOUR

WEST HOLLYWOOD

Photo by Elizabeth Daniels Photography

Delilah

Delilah, a grand and expansive take on the supper club by the h.wood Group, has established itself as a premier weekend dining destination for celebrities in West Hollywood. A luxurious blend of Art Deco aesthetics and modern American cuisine, this sultry restaurant-lounge exudes the vibes of the roaring '20s. Frequented by A-listers like Justin Bieber, Kendall Jenner, Leah Marie Talabi, Chloe Sims, and Drake, Delilah offers a striking atmosphere with plush banquettes bathed in the soft glow of chandeliers, globe lanterns, and candlelight—a Gatsby-esque nod to Hollywood's golden era. The menu features classic American fare, including impeccably prepared dishes like chicken tenders, burgers, and filet mignon steak. With live performers, surprise acts, and lounge-style bottle service, Delilah provides a space where eating, drinking, and dancing seamlessly converge. The allure of this Art Deco gem is heightened by the strict no-photo policy indoors, allowing celebrities to unwind off-guard while enjoying the exquisite ambiance of one of West Hollywood's most beautiful and exclusive spots.

Delilah, 7969 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046

Olivetta

Olivetta, located in West Hollywood on Melrose Boulevard, has become a hotspot for celebrity sightings, offering a vibrant atmosphere adorned with colorful wallpaper and lively conversations. Renowned chef Michael Fiorelli ensures that the food and cocktails at Olivetta speak for themselves, featuring a coastal European menu with Mediterranean classics like grilled Spanish octopus and branzino. The 150-seat bungalow, designed by Tom Parker, stands out for its simplicity and savory dishes, rich with citrus flavors. Celebrities like Lionel Richie, Tinashe, and Mandana Bolourchi have been spotted at Olivetta, adding to the allure of this West Hollywood gem. Despite the signs discouraging photos, the restaurant offers a delightful dining experience, with standout dishes including the lamb Bolognese radiatore and rye macaroni with kale and sausage. The warm, toasted sourdough is also a must-try, making Olivetta a must-visit destination for both its culinary delights and celebrity appeal.

Olivetta, 9010 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Katana

Katana stands as a stunning Japanese restaurant offering an exquisite selection of Robata, traditional sushi, specialty rolls, and an array of Japanese delicacies. Located above the iconic Sunset Strip, diners can indulge in the culinary delights while lounging on the al fresco patio. The restaurant has become a favorite among celebrities, attracting notable figures such as Drake, Matt Kemp, Hayden Panettiere, LeBron James, Eva Longoria, Rachel McAdams, Britney Spears, and Dr. Dre. An insider tip for an enhanced celebrity-spotting experience is to request a seat on the front patio, where rappers, NBA athletes, and pop stars often enjoy sushi and Robata, surrounded by their entourages, creating an atmosphere of glamour and exclusivity.

Katana, 8439 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Cecconi’s

Cecconi's stands as a culinary gem and popular celebrity haunt. As part of The Soho House Group, Cecconi's combines exquisite Italian dishes with a laid-back yet glamorous atmosphere, drawing in the likes of Ellen DeGeneres, Gwen Stefani, and Jennifer Lopez. The plant-lined patio and marble-floored dining room create an inviting backdrop for guests, both A-listers and locals alike. According to GM & Sommelier Marino Monferrato, celebrities frequent Cecconi's because, like all patrons, they find it to be a safe haven for a great, relaxing meal where everyone is treated like a VIP. Chef Andrea Cavaliere's seasonal Italian menu features delights like plin agnolotti with black truffles, wood-roasted salmon with rapini, and cicchetti, Italy's answer to tapas. Cecconi's reputation as an exclusive yet accessible dining destination ensures that any visit is not just a culinary experience but also an opportunity to share a space with some of Hollywood's biggest names.

Cecconi’s, 8764 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Catch LA

Indulge in a star-studded culinary spectacle at Catch LA, the West Coast gem crafted by nightlife maestros Mark Birnbaum and Eugene Remm, known for their original Catch restaurant in NYC. Located on Melrose Avenue in the heart of West Hollywood, Catch LA transcends the ordinary, offering an al fresco dining experience adorned with the glitz and glamour of celebrity sightings. The menu, an exquisite fusion of modern Japanese lounge fare with a nod to Nobu-inspired luxury, presents a diverse array of delights, including vegan and gluten-free options crafted from locally sourced ingredients. Beyond the tantalizing cuisine, the allure of Catch LA lies in its guest list, with luminaries such as Cindy Crawford, Madison Beer, Sylvester Stallone, Quincy Jones, Suede Brooks, and the Jenner sisters gracing its tables. As paparazzi gather outside in hopes of capturing a glimpse of Hollywood's elite, inside, patrons are treated to an unforgettable blend of gastronomic excellence and A-list ambiance, making Catch LA an essential destination for those seeking the epitome of West Coast nightlife and dining.

Catch LA, 8715 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Dan Tana's

Dan Tana's Restaurant has long been a revered institution for those seeking not only classic Italian cuisine but also the chance to rub shoulders with Hollywood's elite. Since its establishment in 1963, this old-school gem has been a staple for celebrities, and it's not uncommon to spot A-listers like George Clooney, Elton John, and Cameron Diaz enjoying the timeless charm of its red leather booths and checkered tablecloths. Offering a genuine taste of LA's dining scene, Dan Tana's has been a cherished haunt for legendary stars, from The Eagles to current favorites like Jon Hamm and Olivia Wilde. The menu pays homage to its famous clientele with dishes named after stars, including the Veal Cutlet Milanese a la George Clooney and the Steak & Peppers Sinatra. With an atmosphere that exudes family-style Italian charm and a history steeped in Hollywood glamour, Dan Tana's continues to be a magnetic draw for showbiz luminaries and anyone seeking an authentic taste of Tinseltown.

Dan Tana's, 9071 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Gracias Madre

Gracias Madre, the hip vegan haven nestled in West Hollywood, has become a hotspot for celebrity sightings, drawing in an impressive roster of A-listers including Natalie Portman, Ellen Degeneres, Mariah Carey, Selena Gomez, Jessica Alba, Amy Adams, Jesse Metcalfe, Olivia Munn, and Sophia Bush. Paparazzi strategically position themselves just outside the door, anticipating the arrival of these well-known regulars. Chef Chandra Gilbert's fresh and flavorful Mexican cuisine, crafted from all-organic ingredients, is a major draw for both vegetarians and omnivores alike. The airy white interior and the charming courtyard along Melrose Avenue provide an inviting backdrop for patrons, making Gracias Madre not only a culinary destination but also a celebrity haven where the intersection of vegan delights and Hollywood glamour creates an unparalleled dining experience.

Gracias Madre, 8905 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Craig's

Craig's, situated on Melrose Avenue in West Hollywood, has solidified its status as a celebrity magnet since opening its doors in 2011. Renowned for its American homestyle cuisine and dark cushioned booths, this hotspot has become synonymous with A-list sightings. With a stellar cast of regulars including Kim Kardashian, George Clooney, and Joe Jonas, Craig's exudes an air of exclusivity that often draws paparazzi hoping to capture glimpses of Hollywood royalty. Chef Kursten Kizer crafts an eclectic American menu featuring comfort classics like meatloaf and chicken parmigiana, alongside innovative offerings such as Buffalo wing pizza and the signature Meldman's honey truffle fried chicken served on corn pancakes. Chrissy Teigen, John Legend, Cindy Crawford, Emily Ratajkowski, Nicole Scherzinger, Jessica Alba, Alex Rodriguez, and Martin Scorsese are just a few more luminaries who have added to the restaurant's star-studded ambiance. Whether you're savoring their phenomenal table bread or delving into vegan specialties, dining at Craig's guarantees not just a culinary experience but an immersion into the glamorous world of Hollywood's elite.

Craig's, 8826 Melrose Ave, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Cavatina

Cavatina emerges as a culinary gem that beckons not only with its market-fresh ingredients and California vibes but also as a hotspot for celebrity sightings. The restaurant, surprisingly fantastic for a hotel, is skillfully helmed by celebrity chef Michael Schlow and rising star chef Chris Turano, offering a palate-pleasing experience for its elite clientele. The main dining room exudes casual elegance, but in true LA fashion, the allure extends outdoors, where patrons can revel in the celestial beauty above and perhaps spot a star or two around them. With a long association with rock 'n' roll legends dating back to 1963, Cavatina has welcomed an array of music luminaries, including regulars like Steven Tyler of Aerosmith and repeat visitor Anthony Kiedis of the Red Hot Chili Peppers. The Sunset Marquis has played host to iconic figures like Ozzy Osbourne, Green Day, Dave Grohl, Chris Cornell, Heart, and Morrissey, ensuring that every dining experience at Cavatina is not just a feast for the senses but also an opportunity to share a space with some of the biggest names in the music industry. For breakfast, lunch, or dinner, reservations at Cavatina offer a chance to dine amidst the timeless allure of Sunset Marquis and the legendary figures it continues to attract.

Cavatina, 1200 Alta Loma Rd, West Hollywood, CA 90069

The Ivy

The Ivy in West Hollywood stands as the epitome of celebrity spotting, offering an unrivaled experience where stars casually dine in full view on the patio, surrounded by the iconic white picket fence, while eager paparazzi capture snapshots from across Robertson Boulevard. Sipping on a signature Ivy Gimlet might transport you into a scene reminiscent of John Travolta and Danny DeVito in the memorable film Get Shorty. Despite sharing a name with the renowned celebrity-favorite restaurant in London, The Ivy in West Hollywood holds its own in attracting A-listers. Notable figures like George Clooney and Jennifer Aniston frequent this establishment for its classic Californian cuisine. Amidst the homely decor, adorned with floral tablecloths and plush cushions, visitors are made to feel right at home. The paparazzi remain a constant presence outside this kitschy-cute, country cottage, eagerly waiting to capture shots of Paris Hilton, Jennifer Lopez, Steven Spielberg, Quentin Tarantino, and anyone who's someone in LA.

The Ivy, 113 N Robertson Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048

Madeo Restaurant

Tucked away in West Hollywood, Madeo Restaurant stands as a mecca for celebrity sightings amidst its opulent Northern Italian ambiance. Navigating through the paparazzi-lined entrance is a small price to pay for a chance to dine on exquisite, albeit pricey, Italian cuisine. This bustling hideout has earned its reputation as a favored hotspot for Hollywood's elite, attracting industry power players ranging from starlets to studio head honchos. Despite the cramped tables and bustling atmosphere, Madeo remains a go-to spot for those seeking an authentic Italian experience. Celebrity regulars such as Sophia Loren, Ricky Gervais, Doc Rivers, Michelle Rodriguez, Larry David, and Lisa Kudrow have all graced its tables. Adding a personal touch, the owner takes the time to greet each patron, celebrity or not, in Italian, enhancing the charm of this renowned establishment. For those eager to spot a celebrity, the insider tip is simple: if paparazzi linger outside, there's undoubtedly someone of note inside. Given the restaurant's penchant for running fashionably late, arriving early for reservations provides the perfect opportunity to enjoy the bar scene and engage in prime people-watching while awaiting a table in this iconic celebrity haven.

Madeo Restaurant, 8490 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069

Hugo's

Hugo's West Hollywood has become a Hollywood hotspot, not just for its delectable breakfasts but also for the star-studded clientele it attracts. According to the Zagat Survey, the breakfast experience at Hugo's rivals that of Tiffany's, and it seems that sentiment resonates with numerous celebrities. Regular sightings include comedy legend Jerry Seinfeld, Denzel Washington, Keanu Reeves, Julia Roberts, Hayden Christensen, Kim Basinger, Jane Fonda, Bette Midler, Ted Turner, Eric Clapton, Winona Ryder, and the iconic David Bowie. Even on Labor Day in 2011, "Dexter" star Michael C. Hall and comedienne Sarah Silverman chose Hugo's for their lunch rendezvous. With its unassuming charm on Santa Monica Blvd., Hugo's has cemented its status as a go-to "power breakfast" destination, where the early risers of the entertainment industry can casually mingle and enjoy a meal in the midst of Hollywood's glittering ambiance.

Hugo's, 8401 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069

SANTA MONICA

Ivy at the Shore

On the picturesque patio of Ivy at the Shore, you'll likely find yourself in the company of numerous celebrities, as it's a favored dining spot for the famous and infamous alike. Icons such as Paris Hilton, Lindsay Lohan, Dustin Hoffman, and Robert De Niro have all graced its tables. The allure of encountering Hollywood A-listers extends beyond Ivy at the Shore to renowned establishments like Spago on N. Canon, Koi on La Cienega, and Mr. Chow on N., making the chance of a star-studded encounter quite high. Ivy at the Shore, a seaside offshoot of chef-owner Richard Irving and Lynn Von Kersting, sits near the Santa Monica Pier and boasts a delightful ambiance with a pastel pink and olive green color scheme. The patio overlooks a cliff-top park, offering a charming setting for enjoying mesquite grilled seafood, delectable crab cakes, and a mouthwatering Maine lobster Cobb salad. Its universal appeal as a comfortable dining spot has attracted a diverse clientele, including none other than President Bill Clinton, transcending celebrity status.

Ivy at the Shore, 1535 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90401

Giorgio Baldi

Il Ristorante di Giorgio Baldi in Santa Monica has earned its reputation as a discreet haven for celebrity sightings, boasting an impressive roster of stars including Rihanna, Drake, Mila Kunis, Ashton Kutcher, Lindsay Lohan, and Taylor Swift among its regular clientele. Despite its unassuming exterior, this high-end Italian eatery becomes a buzzing hotspot by evening, drawing in a crowd of Hollywood's elite and curious onlookers alike. The intimate ambiance sets the stage for chance encounters with everyone from seasoned actors to chart-topping musicians, turning a simple dinner into a star-studded affair. Amidst the aroma of authentic Italian cuisine and the gentle hum of whispered conversations, Giorgio Baldi offers a glimpse into the glamorous world of L.A.'s celebrity scene, where every patron is treated like royalty and every meal is infused with a sprinkle of stardust.

Giorgio Baldi, 114 W Channel Rd, Santa Monica, CA 90402

HOLLYWOOD

Beauty & Essex

Nestled within the glamorous Dream Hotel complex in Hollywood, Beauty & Essex emerges as one of Tinseltown's trendiest hotspots, boasting an all-encompassing experience curated by the renowned TAO Group. This stylish compound houses the signature Tao Asian bistro, Luchini pizzeria and bar, Avenue upscale bar and lounge, The Highlight Room rooftop lounge, and the grand restaurant and lounge, Beauty & Essex, adorned with a magnificent 20-foot oval skylight. A-list celebrities such as Selena Gomez, Kylie Jenner, and Cardi B, who celebrated her birthday here in 2018, have graced the venue. Chef Chris Santos captivates their palates with share-friendly plates like Caesar toast with crispy chicken skin and a 24-ounce bone-in ribeye served with truffle Hollandaise, elevating the dining experience to a star-studded affair. Frequented by Hollywood's elite, including Beyoncé and Jay-Z, The Weeknd, Selena Gomez, and Paris Hilton, Beauty & Essex stands as a testament to luxury and celebrity allure in the heart of Hollywood.

Jon & Vinny’s

Jon & Vinny's is not only renowned for its delectable Italian cuisine but also for being a celebrity magnet. A favored date night spot for A-list couples, this charming eatery has hosted the likes of Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson, who shared slices of pizza in the relaxed ambiance. The dynamic duo of Chrissy Teigen and John Legend has also graced the restaurant, as well as the iconic power couple Jay-Z and Beyoncé, adding to the star-studded allure of Jon & Vinny's. The red carpet premiere of the new Hulu show, The Kardashians, brought a Hollywood spectacle to the Italian hot spot, with Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson joined by Kourtney Kardashian, Travis Barker, Jonathan Cheban, and Tracy and Roy Romulus for an unforgettable dining experience. With its casual yet chic atmosphere and a menu that entices even the most discerning palates, Jon & Vinny's remains a must-visit destination for both food enthusiasts and those hoping to catch a glimpse of their favorite celebrities enjoying a slice of Hollywood life.

Jon & Vinny’s, 412 N Fairfax Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90036

Crossroads Kitchen

If you're aiming to casually mingle with Hollywood's elite, a visit to Crossroads Kitchen is a must. Under the culinary mastery of renowned chef Tal Ronnen, this upscale vegan dining establishment has become a haven for countless entertainers seeking the finest in plant-based cuisine. Whether vegan or not, the allure of Ronnen's culinary creations has attracted a who's who of celebrities, including luminaries like Jane Fonda and Paul McCartney. What sets Crossroads apart as the epicenter of LA's plant-based dining scene is its ability to defy stereotypes associated with vegan food. Celebrities indulging in vegan delights find solace in comfortable booths, perusing extensive wine lists, and savoring Ronnen's seasonal menus featuring delectable offerings like the spinach and artichoke tart and stuffed squash blossoms. The star-studded list of patrons extends to Alicia Silverstone, Addison Rae, Jay Z, Beyoncé, Ellen DeGeneres, Tobey Maguire, Joaquin Phoenix, Rooney Mara, Miley Cyrus, and more, while celebrity chefs from the Food Network have also showered the restaurant with acclaim.

Crossroads Kitchen, 8284 Melrose Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90046

Mother Wolf

Step into the glamorous world of Hollywood at Mother Wolf, a sprawling Italian restaurant that may not be as star-studded as it once was, but still offers a high probability of celebrity sightings, with familiar faces from Super Bowl commercials and beyond. The ballroom-esque dining room sets the stage for a lively atmosphere, adorned with ornate chandeliers and a negroni-fueled bar area that rivals the sophistication of Sunset Tower. The ambiance is a unique blend of Las Vegas allure, Carbone's elegance, and the grandeur of a Roman banquet hall, all condensed into the iconic Madonna Inn. As you savor the culinary delights, with a focus on pasta favorites like cacio e pepe and all’amatriciana, keep your eyes peeled for celebrities. Mother Wolf has played host to the likes of Brad Pitt, Chrissy Teigen and Mark Wahlberg, adding to the restaurant's allure as a celebrity hotspot. Recently, the Simply Giada star, Giada De Laurentiis, fresh from her fabulous trip to Italy, graced the venue with her presence, indulging in a feast of burrata with peaches, various pasta dishes, and delightful gelato alongside friends. Mother Wolf continues to be a go-to destination for those seeking a taste of Italy and the chance to dine amidst Hollywood's glitterati.

Mother Wolf, 1545 Wilcox Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90028

Photo by Elizabeth Daniels

The Nice Guy

Nestled in West Hollywood, The Nice Guy stands as an exclusive and iconic fusion of a restaurant and a nightclub, capturing the essence of a Goodfellas-themed spot. Founded by John Terzian and Brian Toll, also the visionaries behind LA favorites Bootsy Bellows and Shorebar, this establishment has become synonymous with upscale and trendy dining. Known for its reservation-only policy, The Nice Guy attracts an eminent clientele, including celebrities like Justin Bieber, Rihanna, Selena Gomez, Drake, and Katy Perry. The interior pays homage to the Mafia era with vintage marble and brass accents, creating an intimate atmosphere that encourages conversation and camaraderie. With an alluring mix of Italian-inspired cuisine and a strict no-photos policy to safeguard the privacy of its high-profile patrons, The Nice Guy remains a coveted and elusive hotspot, ensuring a celebrity sighting for those fortunate enough to secure a reservation.

The Nice Guy, 401 N La Cienega Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048

Katsuya

Katsuya Hollywood stands as a beacon of sophisticated dining, seamlessly blending culinary excellence with avant-garde design by Philippe Starck. The ambiance is a masterpiece of bold, provocative, and dramatic decor, adorned with illuminated photographs paying homage to the iconic Geisha. A haven for Hollywood's elite, Katsuya Hollywood offers a glamorous presentation of sushi that lures starlets such as Taylor Swift, Brad Pitt, Kate Hudson, Cameron Diaz, Pamela Anderson, and Gwyneth Paltrow. The allure of exquisite Japanese cuisine combined with the chance to dine amid the opulent atmosphere makes Katsuya Hollywood a premier destination for those seeking both culinary artistry and celebrity sightings.

Katsuya, 6300 Hollywood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028

Osteria Mozza

Osteria Mozza, a renowned Hollywood Italian restaurant, stands out as a hotspot for celebrity sightings, drawing a diverse clientele that includes Rihanna and Thomas Middleditch. Owned by the esteemed chef-lebrity Nancy Silverton, the restaurant has earned its reputation as a culinary gem. The allure extends even to power couple Beyoncé and Jay-Z, who have graced this establishment with their presence. With a Michelin star, Osteria Mozza is celebrated for its commitment to traditional Italian cuisine and seasonal delights, offering an unforgettable dining experience. For those craving Mozza's famed pizza, the adjacent Pizzeria Mozza serves up a delectable selection, ensuring that visitors can savor the best of Italian cuisine in this star-studded locale.

Osteria Mozza, 6602 Melrose Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90038

Joan’s on Third

Joan's on Third has solidified its status as a premier celebrity hangout, drawing in Hollywood's A-listers with its New York-style deli charm and delectable offerings. Frequented by the likes of Ian Somerhalder, Sarah Hyland, Miranda Cosgrove, Johnny Knoxville, and cast members from Broad City, Joan's on Third has become a hotspot where paparazzi often capture celebrities enjoying a meal al fresco, generating a constant buzz around the establishment. With an ambiance that effortlessly blends trendiness with friendliness, Joan's on Third has also played host to Robert Duvall, Jake Gyllenhaal, and Moon Zappa, making it a culinary emporium that transcends its delicious fare to become a social nexus for notable figures. For those hoping to catch a glimpse of stars like Nikki Reed, Alexander Skarsgard, Brooklyn Decker, Nicole Richie, Kate Bosworth, Jared Leto, or Selena Gomez, the insider tip is to head inside, perhaps snagging a seat at a communal table, as the celebs often opt for a more discreet dining experience while still contributing to the vibrant energy of this celebrity-loved locale.

Joan’s on Third, 8350 W 3rd St, Los Angeles, CA 90048

Musso & Frank Grill

Step into the rich history of Hollywood at Musso & Frank Grill, founded by Joseph Musso and Frank Toulet in 1919, quickly establishing itself as one of LA's best restaurants and bars. With an iconic appearance and a classic menu featuring mouthwatering steaks, Musso & Frank has become a Hollywood institution, featured in top movies like Once Upon a Time in Hollywood and Ocean's Eleven. The legendary establishment has been graced by Hollywood royalty of the past, including Charlie Chaplin and Marilyn Monroe, and continues to be a celebrity hotspot today. Expect to rub elbows with the likes of George Clooney or Brad Pitt while savoring a beer at the historic bar. The large red booths have hosted iconic figures such as Jack Nicholson, Michael C. Hall, Tom Selleck, and Sandra Oh. Musso & Frank Grill remains a timeless dining spot where you can order a Martini and steak, soaking in the ambiance that has attracted famous diners like Sean Connery, Keith Richards, Johnny Depp, and Quentin Tarantino, who prominently featured Musso's in Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. Celebrating its centennial, this legendary venue promises a glimpse into Hollywood's golden era and a chance encounter with today's stars.

Musso & Frank Grill, 6667 Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood, CA 90028

BEVERLY HILLS

The Hideaway

Beneath the chic boutiques of the Rodeo Collection, The Hideaway emerges as Beverly Hills' hottest hub for celebrity sightings. Boasting a roster of A-list regulars including Selena Gomez, Elton John, Christina Aguilera, Nicole Scherzinger, and Ashley Benson, this swanky Mexican steakhouse has become synonymous with star-studded dining experiences. Backed by high-profile investors such as Ryan Phillipe and Evan Ross, The Hideaway not only serves up delectable dishes and drinks but also hosts exclusive events that attract the glitterati of Hollywood. Recently, fashion designer Michael Costello celebrated his 40th birthday here, courtesy of Revolve, while even Paula Abdul couldn't resist singing its praises on Instagram. Tucked away from the bustling streets of Beverly Hills, The Hideaway offers a luxurious yet laid-back ambiance, making it the ultimate destination for indulging in gourmet cuisine amidst the glitz and glamour of Tinseltown.

The Hideaway, 421 N Rodeo Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Mr. Chow

Mr. Chow's isn't just a restaurant; it's a star-studded sanctuary where Hollywood's elite converge for exquisite cuisine and clandestine encounters. Since its inception in 1974, this legendary establishment has retained its allure, drawing luminaries like a magnet with its tantalizing blend of upscale Chinese fare and contemporary ambiance. As you savor each delectable dish, you might find yourself rubbing elbows with Kirsten Dunst, Al Pacino, Madonna, Demi Moore, Jacqueline Bissett, or George Clooney, among a constellation of other A-listers who frequent its tables. The air buzzes with excitement as diners indulge in Mr. Chow's signature Imperial Beijing delicacies, all while basking in the glow of modern art adorning the walls. Here, culinary excellence intertwines seamlessly with celebrity mystique, creating an experience that transcends mere dining, embodying the essence of Tinseltown's glamour.

Mr. Chow, 344 N Camden Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

SUGARFISH by sushi nozawa

Indulge in sushi delights at Sugarfish in Beverly Hills, a hotspot where celebrities are often spotted savoring warm-rice nigiri. Among the notable names who have enjoyed the culinary experience at this particular location are Kendall Jenner and her then-boyfriend Blake Griffin, who famously had lunch here a few years ago. This Beverly Hills outlet of Sugarfish stands out as the prime spot for celebrity sightings, with luminaries like Justin Bieber and Taylor Swift gracing its tables. While Sugarfish, with locations spanning Downtown L.A., the Valley, and the Beach Cities, attracts a wide array of A-listers, it's the Beverly Hills venue that remains the go-to for stars seeking the perfect sushi fix. Join the ranks of celebrity patrons, including Larry David, Jennifer Garner, Megan Fox, Julianne Hough, and Ashton Kutcher, at this chic destination, where sushi aficionados can indulge in the exquisite dineL.A. lunch and dinner menus across all ten Sugarfish locations.

Sugarfish, 212 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Spago

Spago, Wolfgang Puck's flagship restaurant, has been an enduring haven for celebrity sightings. Puck, the original celebrity chef, often graces both the dining room and kitchen, engaging with a mix of A-listers, both seasoned and emerging. While the groundbreaking culinary innovations of three decades ago might have evolved, Spago's cuisine remains a testament to polished, seasonally-driven, and undeniably upscale dining. The cozy, fairy-lit terracotta courtyard provides an intimate setting to savor Puck's legendary modern Californian fare, featuring exquisite dishes like black pearl Kaluga caviar cannoli and tempura soft-shell crab. With an extensive selection of 30,000 wines, Spago is a favorite among notable personalities such as Jeffrey Katzenberg, Sharon Stone, Gwen Stefani, and Tom Hanks, solidifying its status as a premier destination for both culinary excellence and celebrity encounters.

Spago, 176 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Il Pastaio

Il Pastaio is an upscale Italian gem owned by renowned chef Giacomino Drago, known for its patio and celebrity clientele. Among the notable stars who favor this culinary hotspot is Bella Hadid, often spotted meeting with her father and brother for lunch, creating countless paparazzi moments capturing the family enjoying the restaurant's ambiance. Other famous faces that have graced Il Pastaio include Hailey Baldwin and Kourtney Kardashian. The restaurant has become a go-to spot for Hollywood's elite, attracting the likes of power couple Justin and Hailey Bieber, musical talents Katharine McPhee and David Foster, and the ever-charming Chrissy Teigen and John Legend. Not to mention, Al Pacino himself has been captured enjoying an al fresco lunch at this Beverly Hills celebrity haunt, adding to the allure of Il Pastaio as a preferred destination for both intimate meals and high-profile gatherings.

Il Pastaio, 400 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Matsuhisa

Matsuhisa, Beverly Hills, stands as a culinary institution where sushi enthusiasts and celebrity aficionados converge for an unparalleled dining experience. Chef Nobu Matsuhisa, renowned for his role in "Casino" alongside Robert De Niro, has turned his eponymous restaurant into a hotspot for A-list sightings. Adorned with movie posters bearing De Niro's signature, the venue exudes star-studded allure. Notable guests like Hugh Grant, Mary-Kate Olsen, Al Pacino, Danny DeVito, Martha Stewart, and Drake have all indulged in the exquisite Japanese-Peruvian fusion cuisine. Matsuhisa earned the highest food rating in the 1997 Zagat survey, with the L.A. Times endorsing dishes such as the grilled sea bass in sake lees and the preferred omakase tasting menu. Beyond its celebrity appeal, Matsuhisa remains a culinary empire, with over 40 locations globally, embodying Chef Nobu's legacy as a trailblazer in fine dining that continues to captivate diners worldwide.

Matsuhisa, 129 N La Cienega Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211

La Scala

La Scala stands as an iconic Italian restaurant, renowned not only for its delectable cuisine but also as a hotspot for celebrity sightings. The restaurant's upscale casual dress code sets the stage for a sophisticated ambiance, making it a favored destination for Hollywood's elite. Over the years, La Scala has hosted a parade of A-listers, including the likes of Brad Pitt, John Legend, Taylor Swift, and Wayne Rogers, adding to its allure. As patrons indulge in the savory flavors of classic Italian dishes, they may find themselves sharing the same space with their favorite stars, making La Scala an irresistible draw for both food enthusiasts and celebrity aficionados alike.

La Scala, 434 N Canon Dr, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

MALIBU

Lucky's Malibu

Lucky's exudes upscale charm as an A-list steakhouse that has become a celebrity magnet. Originally hailing from SoCal's other celebrity haven, Montecito, Lucky's Malibu is a hotspot where the crowd is sure to be recognizable, though perhaps with fewer Oprah and Meghan Markle sightings compared to its Montecito counterpart. As you dine in this luxurious establishment, expect to rub shoulders with Real Housewives sipping martinis, strategically showcasing their jewelry, and surfers who casually strut around in board shorts, boasting not only wave-riding skills but also, on occasion, two Oscars at home. Beyond the captivating people-watching experience, Lucky's offers a culinary delight, with menu highlights including shrimp and prosciutto-filled chopped salad and a tempting selection of premium cuts of meat. The Malibu outpost of Lucky's, located in the Malibu Country Mart, has swiftly become a go-to for Santa Barbara residents and Hollywood A-listers alike, with recent sightings including Kourtney Kardashian, Travis Barker, Cindy Crawford, Pierce Brosnan, and Kendall Jenner, cementing its status as a coveted celebrity hotspot.

Lucky's Malibu, 3835 Cross Creek Rd Suite #18, Malibu, CA 90265

Mr. Chow

Mr. Chow, a high-end Chinese restaurant with a well-established reputation, stands as a prime celebrity hotspot in California. Renowned for its exquisite cuisine, this upscale dining establishment has received stellar reviews from locals and celebrities alike. Among the notable names who have graced Mr. Chow's tables are Jennifer Lopez, Jim Carrey, Nicolas Cage, Madonna, Mariah Carey, Paula Abdul, Cher, Tyra Banks, Britney Spears, Adele, and Elton John. These A-list sightings, combined with the restaurant's longstanding popularity, make Mr. Chow a go-to destination for those seeking an elegant dining experience and a chance encounter with Hollywood royalty.

Mr. Chow, 3835 Cross Creek Rd #18A, Malibu, CA 90265

Nobu Malibu

Recently, patrons at Nobu Malibu were treated to a sighting of NFL star Travis Kelce and pop sensation Taylor Swift. The pair was spotted enjoying a private dinner together on the restaurant's outdoor terrace, overlooking the picturesque Pacific Ocean. Dressed in casual yet stylish attire, Kelce and Swift seemed to be engrossed in lively conversation as they savored the renowned Japanese cuisine Nobu Malibu is known for. Their presence added to the allure of the restaurant, reaffirming its status as a hotspot for both gastronomic delights and celebrity encounters. Notable personalities, from Demi Lovato and Leonardo DiCaprio to Rosie Huntington-Whiteley and Jason Statham, have also been sighted at Nobu Malibu, further cementing its reputation as a favorite haunt for Hollywood's elite. The restaurant's airy ambiance, characterized by floor-to-ceiling wood and cushioned lounge chairs, complements the crashing waves and offers an unmatched dining experience. Indulging in signature dishes like monkfish pate with caviar, black cod with miso, and roasted king crab with uni, celebrities and discerning diners alike flock to Nobu Malibu for a taste of perfection.

Nobu Malibu, 22706 Pacific Coast Hwy, Malibu, CA 90265

Café Habana

Café Habana at Malibu Country Mart stands out as a chic spot that effortlessly draws in numerous stars. Co-owned by supermodel Cindy Crawford and her husband Rande Gerber, this café has become a celebrity magnet. Notable personalities, including Harry Styles, Kenny G, David Foster, Pierce Brosnan, Matthew McConaughey, Camila Alves, and Serena Williams, have graced its tables. The picturesque location and commitment to eco-conscious dining, featuring organic produce and sustainable seafood, make Café Habana a favored destination for the health-conscious and environmentally aware crowd. The relaxed atmosphere and star-studded clientele contribute to the café's reputation as a top spot for celebrity sightings in Malibu.

Café Habana, 3939 Cross Creek Rd, Malibu, CA 90265

BRENTWOOD

A.O.C. Brentwood

At The Scene, located in posh Brentwood and helmed by the esteemed chef Suzanne Goin, spotting celebrities is as commonplace as savoring the delectable Cal-Med cuisine. The restaurant, the grandest in Goin's empire, attracts stars and their agents who indulge in the Blue Room lounge's casual ambiance or the Atrium's more formal and quiet back room, with the coveted back corner banquette. From chopped chicken salads to burgers, fries, and even onion rings, the menu caters to Hollywood's elite. A roster of A-listers, including Jessica Alba, Forest Whitaker, Ryan Phillippe, Cindy Crawford, Kate Hudson, Gwyneth Paltrow, Diane Lane, and Josh Brolin, frequent The Scene. For those seeking a taste of the superstar experience on a budget, the insider tip suggests heading to the restaurant's bakery/cafe, the Larder, where premade sides like the favored farro salad are available. And, unlike Hollywood starlets, patrons are encouraged to indulge in the bakery's irresistible chocolate chip cookies.

A.O.C. Brentwood, 11648 San Vicente Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90049

Toscana

In the upscale neighborhood of Brentwood, Toscana stands as a rustic trattoria offering authentic Italian cuisine that has become a magnet for celebrity sightings. Nestled on San Vicente, the restaurant boasts a cozy atmosphere, delectable Tuscan fare, and an outstanding wine list, making it a favored haunt among the stars who call Brentwood home. Toscana's easygoing ambiance provides a respite from the bustling atmosphere of the rest of Los Angeles, drawing in celebrities seeking a laid-back dining experience. Taylor Swift is rumored to be a fan, and the list of celebrity patrons includes acclaimed actor Michael Keaton, Patricia Wettig, and American Idol star Katharine McPhee. Toscana Brentwood has solidified its status as a top choice for high-profile celebrities and business figures, making it a place where one might casually spot icons like Arnold Schwarzenegger or Robert Downey Jr.

Toscana, 11633 San Vicente Blvd # 100, Los Angeles, CA 90049

PACIFIC PALISADES

Vittorio's Ristorante & Pizzeria

Vittorio's Ristorante & Pizzeria is another family-owned and operated restaurant that has been a staple of Pacific Palisades since 1984. Owned by Mercedes Pellegrini, Vittorio's specializes in Southern Italian cuisine, catering to generations of families and Hollywood stars. Nestled in the hills of Pacific Palisades, Vittorio's offers a warm and friendly atmosphere, making everyone feel like part of the family. Their fresh seafood and succulent veal and chicken dishes allow you to taste the old country, bringing you a true Italian experience that you are sure to remember.

Vittorio's Ristorante & Pizzeria, 16646 Marquez Ave, Pacific Palisades, CA 90272

Casa Nostra Ristorante

Casa Nostra Ristorante is a cozy and relaxed Italian restaurant located in the hills of Pacific Palisades. Casa Nostra Ristorante is passionate about bringing the tastes of Italy to your table, using high-quality, imported Italian products, and the freshest locally grown produce. This restaurant offers classic Italian cuisine in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Whether you are looking for a romantic dinner or a family gathering, Casa Nostra Ristorante is the perfect spot.

Casa Nostra Ristorante, 1515 Palisades Dr, Pacific Palisades, CA 90272

Erewhon

Erewhon holds an esteemed status as the quintessential Los Angeles hotspot for celebrity sightings, with its multiple locations across the city. From Silverlake to Studio City, Pacific Palisades to Venice, this upscale grocer is the go-to destination for the "see and be seen" crowd. Renowned for its celebrity-endorsed smoothie collaborations—like Sofia Richie Grainge's recent addition—the store epitomizes LA's health-conscious culture. Erewhon's allure extends beyond its organic offerings; it has become a backdrop for reality television, notably appearing on Keeping Up With The Kardashians. Regular patrons include A-listers like Eva Longoria, Hailey and Justin Bieber, and of course, the Kardashians themselves, often sporting a relaxed, everyday aesthetic amidst the aisles.

Erewhon, 15285 Sunset Blvd, Pacific Palisades, CA 90272

LARCHMONT

Café Gratitude

Café Gratitude on Larchmont has become synonymous with celebrity sightings in Los Angeles, drawing in not just health-conscious diners but also A-listers seeking a taste of its empowering menu offerings. As patrons indulge in items like the I Am Glorious Caeser Wrap, and I Am Loving Black Rice Bowl, they might find themselves sharing a meal with the likes of Kerry Washington, Jay-Z, Beyoncé, Rashida Jones, Jake Gyllenhaal, or Connie Britton, adding a sprinkle of stardust to their dining experience. It's not just about the food; it's about the electric atmosphere, where every bite comes with the possibility of a star-studded encounter.

Café Gratitude, 639 N Larchmont Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90004

VENICE

Gjelina

Gjelina, nestled along Venice’s Abbot Kinney Boulevard, has not only captured the hearts of locals with its locally-sourced, produce-forward fare but also become a magnet for celebrity sightings. Since its establishment in 2008, it has served as a culinary haven where stars like Ian Somerhalder, Jessica Simpson, Julia Roberts, Bradley Cooper, Olivia Wilde, and Reese Witherspoon have been spotted enjoying its gastronomic delights. Amidst the bustling atmosphere of this culinary cornerstone, diners may find themselves rubbing elbows with Hollywood's elite, further enhancing the restaurant's reputation as a hotspot for both exceptional cuisine and star-studded encounters.

Gjelina, 1429 Abbot Kinney Blvd, Venice, CA 90291
